title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code by removing the term "qualifying" from "qualifying service-connected disability" and repealing the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code by removing certain subsections and paragraphs related to disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code by removing subsections and paragraphs related to disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. Specifically, the amendment includes changes to retired pay for qualified retirees under chapter 61 with fewer than 20 years of creditable service, subject to reduction under sections 5304 and 5305 of title 38. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends retired pay for qualified retirees under chapter 61 with fewer than 20 years of creditable service, subject to reduction under sections 5304 and 5305 of title 38. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act adjusts retired pay for eligible retirees under chapter 61, exceeding a certain percentage of creditable service multiplied by the retired pay base. Clerical amendments include changing the section heading to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. The section heading and table of sections are amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Section 1413a(f) is amended for this purpose. The effective date for these amendments is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service is amended to include those entitled to retired pay (other than by reason of section 12731b of this title). Computation rules are also adjusted for retirees with fewer than 20 years of service. The computation rules for combat-related special compensation eligibility are amended for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service, reducing the payment for retirees with fewer than 20 years of creditable service. The payment for combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees under chapter 61 with less than 20 years of service is reduced based on their retired pay amount exceeding a certain calculation. The amendments made by this section will affect combat-related disabled uniformed services retirees under chapter 61 with less than 20 years of service, reducing their payments based on a specific calculation. The effective date for these changes will be the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act, applying to payments from that date onwards.
